author: Coral Barry
title: Philippe Coutinho and Roberto Firmino must make 6,000-mile return trip three days before derby
text:
Philippe Coutinho has become a key member of the Brazil squad (Picture: Getty) Liverpool duo Philippe Coutinho and Roberto Firmino face a race against time to be fit for the Everton derby this Saturday.
Revealed: The real reason Jamie Vardy looked like he was wearing make-up The attacking pair are on international duty with Brazil and are set to play on Wednesday morning against Paraguay.
The World Cup qualifier is a crucial game for Brazil and is set to kick off around 2am UK time on Wednesday.
Liverpool play Everton on Saturday (Picture: Getty) Firmino and Coutinho both played a key role in Brazil’s 4-1 win over Uruguay last Thursday and are set to play a part in their final international fixture.
Liverpool will then fly their star men back to Melwood from Sao Paulo which is a trip that covers around 6,000 miles.
Liverpool fixtures Man City (A) – Sun 19 Mar
Everton (H) – Sat 1 Apr
Bournemouth (H) – Wed 5 Apr
Stoke City (A) – Sat 8 Apr
West Brom (A) – Sun 16 Apr
Crystal Palace (H) – Sun 23 Apr

Southampton (H) – Sat 6 May
Roberto Firmino played in the win over Uruguay (Picture: Getty) Jurgen Klopp’s side welcome Everton to Anfield on Saturday for a 12.30pm kick off in a crucial game for the Reds.
Liverpool have Manchester United breathing their necks in fifth place.

Coutinho has yet to find his early-season form since returning from injury, but Firmino has been consistent in front of goal for much of the campaign.
Firmino and Coutinho have often been made undergo grueling trips to and from Liverpool to represent their country.
